intro: Eugenia sturrockii, commonly known as the Sturrock’s eugenia, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Eugenia sturrockii is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
